publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS)
donor.disease_description: Progressive neurodegenerative disorder characterized by cerebellar impairment, bilateral vestibular hypofunction, and sensory neuropathy caused by biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1.

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous gene correction of biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1 using CRISPR/Cas9 genome editing.
genomic_modifications.genotype: Heterozygous deletion of AAGGG expansion determined by PCR and confirmed by Sanger sequencing

genomic_characterisation.summary: No aneuploidies were detected. SNP array analysis confirmed normal karyotype.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K, pEP4 E02S EN2L, pEP4 E02S EM2K (Addgene plasmids #20927, #20922, #20923)

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Royal Children’s Hospital (HREC 28097), Victoria, Australia
